type: ACOUSTIC OBSERVATION PROJECT FOR GREY SEALS AND GREAT WHITE SHARKS
short_summary: The objective of this project is to observe and study the ecology of grey seals and great white sharks in the Magdalen Islands region. The project involves deploying acoustic observation networks, satellite tracking, and tagging of great white sharks. The data gathered from this project will provide valuable insights into the ecology of these species and contribute to the conservation of grey seals and great white sharks.
description: The project will involve deploying acoustic observation networks around the main grey seal colonies in the Iles de la Madeleine region. The network will be used to detect the presence of great white sharks and provide data on their critical habitat. The project will also involve capturing 8 grey seals and equipping them with satellite transmitters and VMTs. In addition, up to 8 great white sharks will be tagged in September 2023. The data gathered from this project will provide valuable insights into the ecology of grey seals and great white sharks and contribute to the conservation of these species.

full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Project Overview

Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites contractors to bid on a project aimed at deploying an acoustic observation network around key grey seal colonies in the Magdalen Islands region. The project's primary objective is to facilitate the detection of great white sharks and provide essential data on their critical habitat.

The project will also gather information on grey seals' dietary habits, foraging behavior, and interactions with great white sharks. Specifically, the research will focus on understanding the role of grey seals in the decline of groundfish stocks in the southern Gulf of St. Lawrence. The project involves capturing and tagging up to eight live grey seals with satellite transmitters and acoustic transmitters and deploying 12 acoustic receivers in the Magdalen Islands.

#### Technical Requirements

The contractor must:

1. Capture and tag up to eight live grey seals with satellite transmitters and VMTs between September and November 2023.
2. Deploy 12 acoustic receivers in the Magdalen Islands by December 15, 2023.
3. Tag up to eight great white sharks in September 2023.

#### Key Deadlines and Dates

* Publication Date: September 26, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: October 11, 2023, at 13:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: October 16, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: December 15, 2023

#### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Marie-Carmen Sedji at DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or (506) 478-7358.
